summary: Deep Agents CLI is a command-line tool for building AI agents with persistent memory, supporting file operations, shell execution, web search, HTTP requests, task planning, and human-in-the-loop controls.

structure.title: Deep Agents CLI
structure.summary: A CLI tool for building AI agents with persistent memory, supporting file operations, shell execution, web search, HTTP requests, task planning, and human-in-the-loop controls.

nodes.path: cli > Deep Agents CLI > Quick start
nodes.title: Quick start
nodes.summary: A quick start guide for Deep Agents CLI covering API key setup, CLI execution, and task assignment, with optional configuration for installation, model selection, and web search.

nodes.title: Configuration
nodes.summary: Configuration options and commands for Deep Agents CLI, including command-line flags and agent management utilities.

nodes.path: cli > Deep Agents CLI > Interactive mode
nodes.title: Interactive mode
nodes.summary: Describes interactive mode features in Deep Agents CLI, including slash commands, bash command execution, and keyboard shortcuts.

nodes.path: cli > Deep Agents CLI > Set project conventions with memories
nodes.title: Set project conventions with memories
nodes.summary: Agents use memory-first protocol to store, retrieve, and apply project conventions across sessions via markdown files.

nodes.path: cli > Deep Agents CLI > Use remote sandboxes
nodes.title: Use remote sandboxes
nodes.summary: Guide to using remote sandboxes for safe, isolated code execution with providers like Runloop, Daytona, and Modal, including setup and configuration steps.
